# PerlinNoise 
Example:

	for y:=-1600; y>-4600;y=y-16 {
		for x:=-1600;x>-3600;x=x-16 {
			fx:= float32(float32(y)/750.00)
			fy:= float32(float32(x)/750.00)
			test:=PerlinNoise.Noise(fx, fy)
			if test<=-0.01 {
				console.WriteString("~")
			}
			if test>-0.01  && test<0.5 {
				console.WriteString("0")
			}
			if test>=0.5{
				console.WriteString("#")
			}
		}
		console.WriteString("\n")
		
		Out:
